sections.purpose: To capture images of electrophoresis gels for documentation and analysis.
sections.scope: Applicable to molecular microbiology and DNA/RNA analysis.
procedure: Switch ON the transilluminator and camera system.
Place the stained gel on the transilluminator surface.
Close the darkroom hood or door to prevent light interference.
Adjust focus, zoom, and exposure using the control software.
Capture the image and save with an appropriate file name.
Turn OFF the UV light when not actively imaging.
Clean the transilluminator surface after removing the gel.
Shut down the system according to the manufacturer's instructions.
precautions: Wear UV-protective face shield or goggles when working with UV light.
Avoid scratching the transilluminator glass with gel trays.
Handle ethidium bromide or other DNA stains as hazardous chemicals.
Do not place wet gels directly on the camera lens or sensitive surfaces.
Back up image files regularly to secure data.
